BTOOY.summary: B2W - Companhia Digital engages in the e-commerce business through a digital platform in Brazil. The company is involved in the e-commerce and marketplace business through the Americanas.com, Submarino, SouBarato, and Shoptime brands through various distribution channels, such as Internet, telesales, catalogs, TV, and kiosk; and consumer credit activities through Submarino Finance and Digital Finance, as well as payments, credit, and financial businesses through Ame. Its Websites offer products and services in approximately 40 categories, including CDs, DVDs, books, games, computers, beds, bath and beauty products, cameras and photos, housewares, furniture, phones and mobiles, automotive products, electronics, toys, watches, perfumes, home appliances, musical instruments, office products, and other products. The company also offers technology, logistics, distribution, and customer service solutions. The company was formerly known as B2W - Companhia Global do Varejo and changed its name to B2W - Companhia Digital in April 2013. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 191 Vivara stores, 6 Life stores, and 56 kiosks. The company also sells its products through online. Vivara ParticipaÃ§Ãµes S.A. was founded in 1962 and is based in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

VULC3.SA.summary: Vulcabras Azaleia S.A. operates as a footwear company in Brazil. The company provides sports footwear, women's shoes, and sports apparel products, as well as sandals and safety boots. It markets its products under the Azaleia, Dijean, Opanka, Olympikus, Olk, and Vulcabras brand names. The company sells its products through sales representatives and distributors, as well as directly to customers. It has operations in Peru, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Colombia, and internationally. The company was formerly known as Vulcabras S.A. and changed its name to Vulcabras Azaleia S.A. in November 2010. Vulcabras Azaleia S.A. was founded in 1952 and is headquartered in JundiaÃ­, Brazil.

VVAR3.SA.summary: Via Varejo S.A., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the retail of consumer electronics, home appliances, telephony, and furniture in Brazil. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 1,070 stores under the Ponto Frio and Casas Bahia brand names, as well as 16 distribution centers and warehouses. It also offers products through e-commerce platforms, including pontofrio.com, casasbahia.com, and extra.com.br. The company was formerly known as Globex Utilidades SA and changed its name to Via Varejo S.A. in February 2012. Via Varejo S.A. is headquartered in SÃ£o Caetano do Sul, Brazil.

WEST3.SA.summary: Westwing ComÃ©rcio Varejista S.A. engages in the online shopping business in Brazil. It offers decoration, furniture, set table, kitchen utensil, carpet, bed and bath, fashion, and well-being products. The company also sells its products through physical stores. Westwing ComÃ©rcio Varejista S.A. was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Sao Paulo, Brazil.
